trans-unit.source: A quick overview of the networking technologies available for a UWP developer, with suggestions on how to choose the technologies that are right for your app.
trans-unit.target: A quick overview of the networking technologies available for a UWP developer, with suggestions on how to choose the technologies that are right for your app.

trans-unit.source: Sockets
trans-unit.target: Sockets

trans-unit.source: Use [Sockets](sockets.md) when you are communicating with another device and want to use your own protocol.
trans-unit.target: Use [Sockets](sockets.md) when you are communicating with another device and want to use your own protocol.

trans-unit.source: Two implementations of sockets are available for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) developers: [**Windows.Networking.Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960), and [Winsock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms740673).
trans-unit.target: Two implementations of sockets are available for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) developers: [**Windows.Networking.Sockets**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226960), and [Winsock](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/desktop/ms740673).

trans-unit.source: If you are writing new code, then Windows.Networking.Sockets has the advantage of being a modern API, designed for use by UWP developers.
trans-unit.target: If you are writing new code, then Windows.Networking.Sockets has the advantage of being a modern API, designed for use by UWP developers.

trans-unit.source: If you are using cross-platform networking libraries or other existing Winsock code, or prefer the Winsock API, then use that.
trans-unit.target: If you are using cross-platform networking libraries or other existing Winsock code, or prefer the Winsock API, then use that.

trans-unit.source: When to use sockets
trans-unit.target: When to use sockets

trans-unit.source: Both sockets implementations enable you to communicate with other devices using protocols of your own choice, using TCP or UDP.
trans-unit.target: Both sockets implementations enable you to communicate with other devices using protocols of your own choice, using TCP or UDP.

trans-unit.source: Choose the sockets API that best meets your needs based on experience and any existing code you might be using.
trans-unit.target: Choose the sockets API that best meets your needs based on experience and any existing code you might be using.

trans-unit.source: When not to use sockets
trans-unit.target: When not to use sockets

trans-unit.source: Don't implement your own HTTP(S) stack using sockets.
trans-unit.target: Don't implement your own HTTP(S) stack using sockets.

trans-unit.source: Use [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) instead.
trans-unit.target: Use [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) instead.

trans-unit.source: If WebSockets (the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) and [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) classes) meet your communications needs (TCP to/from a web server), consider using them rather than spend your own time and development resources implementing similar functionality with sockets.
trans-unit.target: If WebSockets (the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) and [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) classes) meet your communications needs (TCP to/from a web server), consider using them rather than spend your own time and development resources implementing similar functionality with sockets.

trans-unit.source: Websockets
trans-unit.target: Websockets

trans-unit.source: The [WebSockets](websockets.md) protocol defines a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web.
trans-unit.target: The [WebSockets](websockets.md) protocol defines a mechanism for fast, secure two-way communication between a client and a server over the web.

trans-unit.source: Data is transferred immediately over a full-duplex single socket connection, allowing messages to be sent and received from both endpoints in real time.
trans-unit.target: Data is transferred immediately over a full-duplex single socket connection, allowing messages to be sent and received from both endpoints in real time.

trans-unit.source: WebSockets are ideal for use in real-time gaming where instant social network notifications and up-to-date displays of information (like game statistics ) need to be secure and use fast data transfer.
trans-unit.target: WebSockets are ideal for use in real-time gaming where instant social network notifications and up-to-date displays of information (like game statistics ) need to be secure and use fast data transfer.

trans-unit.source: UWP developers can use the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) and [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) classes to connect with servers that support the Websocket protocol.
trans-unit.target: UWP developers can use the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) and [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) classes to connect with servers that support the Websocket protocol.

trans-unit.source: When to use Websockets
trans-unit.target: When to use Websockets

trans-unit.source: When you want to send and receive data on an ongoing basis between a device and a server.
trans-unit.target: When you want to send and receive data on an ongoing basis between a device and a server.

trans-unit.source: When not to use Websockets
trans-unit.target: When not to use Websockets

trans-unit.source: If you are sending or receiving data infrequently, you might find it simpler to make individual HTTP requests from the device to the server, rather than establish and maintain a WebSocket connection.
trans-unit.target: If you are sending or receiving data infrequently, you might find it simpler to make individual HTTP requests from the device to the server, rather than establish and maintain a WebSocket connection.

trans-unit.source: WebSockets may not be suitable for very high-volume situations.
trans-unit.target: WebSockets may not be suitable for very high-volume situations.

trans-unit.source: Consider modeling your data flows and simulating your traffic through WebSockets before committing to using them in your design.
trans-unit.target: Consider modeling your data flows and simulating your traffic through WebSockets before committing to using them in your design.

trans-unit.source: HttpClient
trans-unit.target: HttpClient

trans-unit.source: Use [HttpClient](httpclient.md) (and the rest of the [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace API) when you are using HTTP(S) to communicate with a web service or a web server.
trans-unit.target: Use [HttpClient](httpclient.md) (and the rest of the [**Windows.Web.Http**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn279692) namespace API) when you are using HTTP(S) to communicate with a web service or a web server.

trans-unit.source: When to use HttpClient
trans-unit.target: When to use HttpClient

trans-unit.source: When using HTTP(S) to communicate with web services.
trans-unit.target: When using HTTP(S) to communicate with web services.

trans-unit.source: When uploading or downloading a small number of smaller files.
trans-unit.target: When uploading or downloading a small number of smaller files.

trans-unit.source: If WebSockets (the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) and [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) classes) meet your communications needs (TCP to/from a web server), and the web server in question supports WebSockets, consider using them rather than spend your own time and development resources implementing similar functionality with HttpClient.
trans-unit.target: If WebSockets (the [**StreamWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226923) and [**MessageWebSocket**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226842) classes) meet your communications needs (TCP to/from a web server), and the web server in question supports WebSockets, consider using them rather than spend your own time and development resources implementing similar functionality with HttpClient.

trans-unit.source: When you are streaming content over the network.
trans-unit.target: When you are streaming content over the network.

trans-unit.source: When not to use HttpClient
trans-unit.target: When not to use HttpClient

trans-unit.source: If you are transferring large files, or large numbers of files, consider using background transfers instead.
trans-unit.target: If you are transferring large files, or large numbers of files, consider using background transfers instead.

trans-unit.source: If you want to be able to restrict upload/download limits based on connection type, or if you want to save progress and resume upload/download after an interruption, you must use background transfers.
trans-unit.target: If you want to be able to restrict upload/download limits based on connection type, or if you want to save progress and resume upload/download after an interruption, you must use background transfers.

trans-unit.source: If you are communicating between two devices and neither one is designed to act as an HTTP(S) server, you should use sockets.
trans-unit.target: If you are communicating between two devices and neither one is designed to act as an HTTP(S) server, you should use sockets.

trans-unit.source: Do not attempt to implement your own HTTP server and use [HttpClient](httpclient.md) to communicate with it.
trans-unit.target: Do not attempt to implement your own HTTP server and use [HttpClient](httpclient.md) to communicate with it.

trans-unit.source: Background transfers
trans-unit.target: Background transfers

trans-unit.source: Use the [background transfer API](background-transfers.md) when you want to reliably transfer files over the network.
trans-unit.target: Use the [background transfer API](background-transfers.md) when you want to reliably transfer files over the network.

trans-unit.source: The background transfer API provides advanced upload and download features that run in the background during app suspension and persist beyond app termination.
trans-unit.target: The background transfer API provides advanced upload and download features that run in the background during app suspension and persist beyond app termination.

trans-unit.source: The API monitors network status and automatically suspends and resumes transfers when connectivity is lost, and transfers are also Data Sense-aware and Battery Sense-aware, meaning that download activity adjusts based on your current connectivity and device battery status.
trans-unit.target: The API monitors network status and automatically suspends and resumes transfers when connectivity is lost, and transfers are also Data Sense-aware and Battery Sense-aware, meaning that download activity adjusts based on your current connectivity and device battery status.

trans-unit.source: These capabilities are essential when your app is running on mobile or battery-powered devices.
trans-unit.target: These capabilities are essential when your app is running on mobile or battery-powered devices.

trans-unit.source: The API is ideal for uploading and downloading large files using HTTP(S).
trans-unit.target: The API is ideal for uploading and downloading large files using HTTP(S).

trans-unit.source: FTP is also supported, but only for downloads.
trans-unit.target: FTP is also supported, but only for downloads.

trans-unit.source: A new background transfer feature in Windows 10 is the ability to trigger post-processing when a file transfer has completed, so that you can update local catalogs, activate other apps, or notify the user when a download is complete.
trans-unit.target: A new background transfer feature in Windows 10 is the ability to trigger post-processing when a file transfer has completed, so that you can update local catalogs, activate other apps, or notify the user when a download is complete.

trans-unit.source: When to use background transfers
trans-unit.target: When to use background transfers

trans-unit.source: Use background transfers to reliably transfer large files, or large numbers of files.
trans-unit.target: Use background transfers to reliably transfer large files, or large numbers of files.

trans-unit.source: Use background transfers with background transfer completion groups when you want to post-process file transfers with a background task.
trans-unit.target: Use background transfers with background transfer completion groups when you want to post-process file transfers with a background task.

trans-unit.source: Use background transfers if you want to be able to resume a transfer in progress after a network interruption.
trans-unit.target: Use background transfers if you want to be able to resume a transfer in progress after a network interruption.

trans-unit.source: Use background transfers if you want to be able to change transfer behavior based on network conditions like being on a metered data plan.
trans-unit.target: Use background transfers if you want to be able to change transfer behavior based on network conditions like being on a metered data plan.

trans-unit.source: When not to use background transfers
trans-unit.target: When not to use background transfers

trans-unit.source: If you are transferring a small number of small files, and you don't need to do any post-processing when the transfer is complete, consider using [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) PUT or POST methods.
trans-unit.target: If you are transferring a small number of small files, and you don't need to do any post-processing when the transfer is complete, consider using [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639) PUT or POST methods.

trans-unit.source: If you want to stream data and use it locally as it arrives, use [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639).
trans-unit.target: If you want to stream data and use it locally as it arrives, use [**HttpClient**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn298639).

trans-unit.source: Additional network-related technologies
trans-unit.target: Additional network-related technologies

trans-unit.source: Connection quality
trans-unit.target: Connection quality

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Networking.Connectivity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207308) API enables you to access network connectivity, cost, and usage information.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Networking.Connectivity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br207308) API enables you to access network connectivity, cost, and usage information.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using this API, see [Accessing network connection state and managing network costs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh452983)
trans-unit.target: For more information about using this API, see [Accessing network connection state and managing network costs](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh452983)

trans-unit.source: DNS Service Discovery
trans-unit.target: DNS Service Discovery

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Networking.ServiceDiscovery.Dnssd**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn895183) API enables you to advertise a network service to other devices on the network using the DNS-SD protocol described in IETF [RFC 2782](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524158).
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Networking.ServiceDiscovery.Dnssd**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn895183) API enables you to advertise a network service to other devices on the network using the DNS-SD protocol described in IETF [RFC 2782](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=524158).

trans-unit.source: Communicating over Bluetooth
trans-unit.target: Communicating over Bluetooth

trans-unit.source: Among other things, the [**Windows.Devices.Bluetooth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263413) API enables you to use Bluetooth to connect to other devices and transfer data.
trans-unit.target: Among other things, the [**Windows.Devices.Bluetooth**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn263413) API enables you to use Bluetooth to connect to other devices and transfer data.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Send or receive files with RFCOMM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270289).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Send or receive files with RFCOMM](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt270289).

trans-unit.source: Push notifications (WNS)
trans-unit.target: Push notifications (WNS)

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Networking.PushNotifications**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241307) API enables you to use the Windows Notification Service (WNS) to receive push notifications over the network.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Networking.PushNotifications**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241307) API enables you to use the Windows Notification Service (WNS) to receive push notifications over the network.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using this API, see [Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187203)
trans-unit.target: For more information about using this API, see [Windows Push Notification Services (WNS) overview](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt187203)

trans-unit.source: Near field communications
trans-unit.target: Near field communications

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Networking.Proximity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241250) API enables you to use near-field communications for apps that use proximity or tap with devices to enable easy data transfer.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Networking.Proximity**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241250) API enables you to use near-field communications for apps that use proximity or tap with devices to enable easy data transfer.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using this API, see [Supporting proximity and tapping](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465229).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using this API, see [Supporting proximity and tapping](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh465229).

trans-unit.source: RSS/Atom feeds
trans-unit.target: RSS/Atom feeds

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Web.Syndication**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243632) API enables you to manage syndication feeds using RSS and Atom formats.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Web.Syndication**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br243632) API enables you to manage syndication feeds using RSS and Atom formats.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using this API, see [RSS/Atom feeds](web-feeds.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about using this API, see [RSS/Atom feeds](web-feeds.md).

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi enumeration and connection control
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi enumeration and connection control

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.WiFi**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn975224) API enables you to enumerate Wi-Fi adapters, scan for available Wi-Fi networks, and connect an adapter to a network.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.WiFi**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn975224) API enables you to enumerate Wi-Fi adapters, scan for available Wi-Fi networks, and connect an adapter to a network.

trans-unit.source: Radio control
trans-unit.target: Radio control

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.Radios**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn996447) API allows you to find and control radios on the local device, including Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.Radios**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn996447) API allows you to find and control radios on the local device, including Wi-Fi and Bluetooth.

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi Direct
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi Direct

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.WiFiDirect**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297687) API allows you to connect and communicate with other local devices using Wi-Fi Direct to create ad-hoc local wireless networks.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.WiFiDirect**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn297687) API allows you to connect and communicate with other local devices using Wi-Fi Direct to create ad-hoc local wireless networks.

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi Direct services
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi Direct services

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.WiFiDirect.Services**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn996481) API enables you to provide Wi-Fi Direct services and connect to them.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.WiFiDirect.Services**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn996481) API enables you to provide Wi-Fi Direct services and connect to them.

trans-unit.source: Wi-Fi Direct Services are the way that one device on a Wi-Fi direct ad-hoc network (a Service Advertiser) offers capabilities to another device (a Service Seeker) over a Wi-Fi Direct connection.
trans-unit.target: Wi-Fi Direct Services are the way that one device on a Wi-Fi direct ad-hoc network (a Service Advertiser) offers capabilities to another device (a Service Seeker) over a Wi-Fi Direct connection.

trans-unit.source: Mobile operators
trans-unit.target: Mobile operators

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 exposes to a wide developer audience some APIs that have previously only been exposed to device manufacturers and mobile operators.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 exposes to a wide developer audience some APIs that have previously only been exposed to device manufacturers and mobile operators.

trans-unit.source: Note that while these APIs are exposed now, they are also gated by specific app capabilities that must be approved by Microsoft before an app can be published.
trans-unit.target: Note that while these APIs are exposed now, they are also gated by specific app capabilities that must be approved by Microsoft before an app can be published.

trans-unit.source: Actual use of these APIs will still be limited primarily to device manufacturers and mobile operators.
trans-unit.target: Actual use of these APIs will still be limited primarily to device manufacturers and mobile operators.

trans-unit.source: Network operations
trans-unit.target: Network operations

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241148) API deals primarily with the configuration and provisioning of phones.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Networking.NetworkOperators**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br241148) API deals primarily with the configuration and provisioning of phones.

trans-unit.source: As such, permission to use the capabilities that control it are limited to device manufacturers and telecom providers.
trans-unit.target: As such, permission to use the capabilities that control it are limited to device manufacturers and telecom providers.

trans-unit.source: SMS
trans-unit.target: SMS

trans-unit.source: The [**Windows.Devices.Sms**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206567) namespace deals with SMS and related messages as low-level entities.
trans-unit.target: The [**Windows.Devices.Sms**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br206567) namespace deals with SMS and related messages as low-level entities.

trans-unit.source: It is provided for use by mobile operators for app-directed SMS use, and is controlled by a capability that will not be approved for use by most app developers.
trans-unit.target: It is provided for use by mobile operators for app-directed SMS use, and is controlled by a capability that will not be approved for use by most app developers.

trans-unit.source: If you are writing an app to deal with messages, you should use the [**Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn642321) API instead, as it is designed to handle not just SMS messages, but also messages from other sources such as realtime chat apps, enabling a much richer chat/messaging experience.
trans-unit.target: If you are writing an app to deal with messages, you should use the [**Windows.ApplicationModel.Chat**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn642321) API instead, as it is designed to handle not just SMS messages, but also messages from other sources such as realtime chat apps, enabling a much richer chat/messaging experience.
